keyMoments.title: Luffy's Complete Breakdown
keyMoments.description: After witnessing all his crewmates disappear one by one, Luffy experiences his most devastating defeat. He collapses to the ground in complete despair, crying out that he couldn't save even a single one of his friends.
keyMoments.significance: This represents Luffy's lowest point in the series and becomes a crucial catalyst for his growth during the timeskip. The weight of his failure as a captain crushes him emotionally.
keyMoments.quote: I couldn't even save a single one of them... Not even one...!

keyMoments.title: Luffy's Disappearance
keyMoments.description: As the last remaining Straw Hat, Luffy is sent flying by Kuma after being told they will never meet again. His disappearance marks the complete separation of the crew.
keyMoments.significance: The final blow in the crew's complete defeat. Luffy being sent away last means he had to witness every single one of his friends disappear before him.

reveals.information: Luffy experiences his most devastating emotional breakdown, revealing the immense weight he feels as captain and his deep love for his crew

name.japanese: バーソロミュー・くま

keyMoments.title: Kuma's Mysterious Message to Rayleigh
keyMoments.description: Kuma whispers something to Rayleigh and asks him to trust him, suggesting his actions have a hidden benevolent purpose.
keyMoments.significance: Plants the seeds for the major revelation about Kuma's true allegiance and intentions, hinting that his separation of the crew may be an act of protection rather than destruction.

keyMoments.title: Completing the Crew's Separation
keyMoments.description: Kuma sends Luffy away as the final Straw Hat, completing the systematic separation of the entire crew.
keyMoments.significance: Kuma successfully executes his mysterious plan to scatter the Straw Hats across the world, with each member sent to a location that will help them grow stronger.
keyMoments.quote: You will never meet one another again. Farewell.

bounties.reason: Former bounty before becoming a Warlord

reveals.information: Kuma's actions may have a hidden benevolent purpose, as hinted by his message to Rayleigh

keyMoments.title: First to Disappear (referenced)
keyMoments.description: Zoro was already sent away by Kuma in the previous episode, and his absence is felt throughout this episode as the remaining crew members are systematically eliminated.
keyMoments.significance: Zoro's prior disappearance set the tragic tone for this episode. As the first mate and strongest fighter, his absence made the crew more vulnerable.

keyMoments.title: Nami's Tearful Disappearance
keyMoments.description: Nami cries out for Luffy to help her as Kuma approaches, but disappears before he can reach her. Her frightened pleas echo as she vanishes.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most emotionally devastating disappearances, as Nami's terror and helplessness particularly affect Luffy, who is powerless to answer her call for help.

keyMoments.title: Usopp's Desperate Stand
keyMoments.description: Despite his fear, Usopp attempts to hold Kuma back to protect his friends, firing at him before being overwhelmed and sent away.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's growth and courage, willing to face an impossibly strong enemy to protect his crew despite knowing he cannot win.

keyMoments.title: Sanji's Rage and Vanishing
keyMoments.description: Enraged by Usopp's disappearance, Sanji charges at Kuma with his powerful kicks but is easily deflected and sent away mid-attack.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that even the crew's strongest fighters cannot harm Kuma, emphasizing the overwhelming power difference and the futility of resistance.
keyMoments.quote: Damn you! I won't let you—

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Chopper's Innocent Plea
keyMoments.description: Chopper, tearful and confused, asks Kuma why he's doing this before being sent away while crying out for his captain.
keyMoments.significance: The disappearance of the crew's youngest and most innocent member emphasizes the cruelty of their defeat and adds emotional weight to the tragedy.

keyMoments.title: Robin's Silent Departure
keyMoments.description: Robin stands quietly and accepts her fate as Kuma approaches, disappearing without struggle in contrast to the panic of others.
keyMoments.significance: Robin's calm acceptance reflects her mature understanding of their situation and her trust in her captain, even in complete defeat.

keyMoments.title: Franky's Disappearance
keyMoments.description: Franky attempts to use his cyborg weapons against Kuma but is completely outmatched and sent away.
keyMoments.significance: Even Franky's technological advantages prove useless against Kuma's overwhelming power.

keyMoments.title: Brook Vanishes First
keyMoments.description: Brook becomes the first crew member to be sent away in this episode, making a final bone joke before disappearing.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the beginning of the systematic separation, setting the tone for the devastating episode. Brook stays in character even in defeat.
keyMoments.quote: Looks like I'm going on a trip... Skull joke!

name.japanese: シルバーズ・レイリー

keyMoments.title: Receives Kuma's Message
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh receives a mysterious message from Kuma who asks him to trust him, suggesting knowledge of Kuma's true intentions.
keyMoments.significance: Rayleigh's understanding of Kuma's message hints at a deeper plan and provides hope that the crew's separation may have a benevolent purpose.

reveals.information: Rayleigh learns something important from Kuma that relates to the crew's fate

keyMoments.title: Explains Kuma's Ability
keyMoments.description: Sentomaru reveals that when Kuma strikes someone with his paw pads, they fly for three days and nights to locations only Kuma knows.
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial information about Kuma's Devil Fruit ability and confirms the crew members are alive but scattered, giving a glimmer of hope.
keyMoments.quote: When Kuma slaps someone with his paw pads, they will be flying for three days and nights. Only Kuma knows where they end up.
